question: ScienceDaily (June 10, 2010) — Scientists are reporting new evidence that drinking coffee may help prevent diabetes and that caffeine may be the ingredient largely responsible for this effect. Their findings, among the first animal studies to demonstrate this apparent link, appear in ACS' Journal of Agricultural and Food Chemistry.http://www.homeschoolacademy.com/academy/refdesk.htm
title: New Evidence That Drinking Coffee May Reduce the Risk of Diabetes
